alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Indian River; Inland Martin; Inland Northern Brevard; Inland Southern Brevard; Inland St. Lucie; Mainland Northern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Northern Brevard Barrier Islands; Okeechobee; Orange; Osceola; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued March 01 at 3:26AM EST until March 01 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility dropping below one quarter mile in dense fog. * WHERE...Portions of east central Florida. * WHEN...Until 9 AM this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...At 325 AM, surface observations, satellite imagery and traffic cameras showed a large area of dense fog spreading east across southern Lake County and the Kissimmee River. Another area of fog was rapidly forming farther east across eastern Orange, Osceola and Okeechobee Counties. Dense fog is expected to continue to spread east across the Space and Treasure Coast counties through sunrise, and linger through 9 AM. Visibilities will drop to one quarter mile or less in many areas.
info.instruction: If you will be out driving on area roadways early this morning, plan on leaving early to allow yourself sufficient time to safely reach your destination at a slower than normal driving speed. Plan to encounter rapid reductions in visibility due to the dense fog. When driving in dense fog, slow down, use your low beam headlights, and leave plenty of driving distance between your car and the one in front of you.
